title: One game banned

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
I got banned for 14 days as a result of one bad game. 

when I logged it said I was banned from 1 game.

We lost a team fight at level 1 and I died.

Then I lost lane to fizz as brand (playing somewhat safe) and died multiple times to him. his duo partner j4 kept camping and I got tower dove all lane phase.

I didn't give up and kept playing and got multiple kills and assists in the later stage of the game and ended up 5/19/14 and apparent that is worthy of a suspension.

I have never been suspended before and never received a warning and am honour level 5.

My last few ranked games have been losses as well, when our whole team did bad.

is it punishable to have a few off games?

replies.body:
RIP the 'YOU PLAYED LIKE SHIT REPORT'

It used to exist in the old client, although i can't remember the actual report, it was mostly just a report to let off steam, i severely doubt it ever actually banned anyone

As for your predicament, like Seras said its not impossible, but if say all 4 people on your team reported you for intentional feeding that would probably trigger the system to ban you (since its basically a tyrant, even the slightest, 'did something wrong" gets you banned these days) also 5/14 is really bad, and could be classified as Intentional feeding, since even people who int, generally don't do that bad (except Yasuo players) 

The amount of games i've purposefully inted (mostly out of spite) haven't even gone that high and i know i've been reported many times, the system hasn't caught me yet (not to say the system doesn't have me on its radar, my perma, and repeated chat bans would be enough for it to want to ban me again)

But as Seras has stated, its just best to send a ticket to riot, have them give you a blanket response and then do nothing about it (this is generally what happens) guess you're stuck for a while, just use an alternate account, honor doesn't mean much anyways so don't worry 'bout it

The report was for 'Unskilled Player' and it was only ever a prompt of sorts for matchmaking (which really didn't have any effect on matchmaking since the system was already accounting for that stuff on it's own), and was never something you could be banned for. It was removed to avoid confusion, because while it did have some value as a meaningless let off steam, it perpetrated this idea that you could be banned for being bad (which isn't and was never true).

In my experience even 4 reports from _different_ games sometimes isn't enough to prompt a gameplay punishment. That system is much slower than any of us would like to confirm and subsequently punish gameplay offences, but ultimately yes, while rare, false punishments aren't impossible.

I'm gonna pretend you didn't just report yourself, but RE support, the first response is often a macro response it's true BUT that doesn't mean it's meaningless. The macro responses address the vast majority of problems, and using a generic "your punishment was valid and will not be revoked" doesn't mean it hasn't been looked into. Support isn't perfect, I'm the first to admit that, and if I see something suspicious or inadequate I do my best to follow it up, but they get a lot of flak they don't deserve as well.

If you want more context or feel your ticket wasn't adequately addressed, a simple reply is enough to escalate it. Pretty much only the first response will ever be pre-prepared (there are of course exceptions, but for the most part, particularly with PB, this is the case).

A little update,

ban is now over and my level 5 honour is wiped, so now I can't even get the end of season rewards.

This is such a joke. no wonder this game is losing people...

Less than 1% of players see any form of punishment. Even if the game is losing numbers (which sure it might be, we don't have recent stats and games hit a point of plateau and then decline, see WoW) it's not because of punished players leaving.
seems like a illegitimate ban, I hope you'll get unbanned soon

Posting your reform card will certainly help us determine why you were punished, but there are only a few things that will net you an instant 14 day ban. From the top of my head, hate speech and things like suicide encouragement, gameplay related offences like feeding or win trading, and boosting which will also result in a loss of all ranked rewards for this season and for any previous.

If the reform card doesn't say much, it's likely your punishment was either gameplay related or the result of a manual review, so if you want more context, you'll have to submit a ticket to player support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

You can also appeal your punishment in the same way if you feel it was made in error.
Seras, is there a penalty/suspension for you-played-shit?

There is not. There's a vague possibility it was a false positive for intent feeding, but given how long the system takes to punish intent feeding because of the time it takes to confirm, that seems rather unlikely. Whatever the case is, and whether OP knows what it is or not, there's more to the story.

Hi Seras,
Thanks for your reply.
I finished the game and went to start another, then it kicked me out of champ select and informed me I was banned.
I logged back in and it said I was banned due to intentionally feeding and it had said "you intentionally fed in these games" and had a link to only one game, the one I just finished.

I definitely did not promote suicidal encouragement or hate speech and the ban was not in relation to that. so I think It is safe to rule those out.

I legitimately believe it was because I played bad one game.

on a side not, what is the reform card? and how do I find it? 

Thanks for your help.

I know a few years ago on the NA server (before OCE Server) I used to get banned abit for AFK, maybe it is to do with that? but I have never been banned or restricted in at least 5 years. and have obtained honour level 5.

Thanks

The reform card is just the little popup box that comes up saying you are banned and why. AFK bans (which result in leaver buster punishment timers) are unrelated to this. The system is tuned way down for intent feeding to prevent false positives (i.e not banning people for just playing badly) so the chance of one is very low, though not impossible.

If you believe the punishment was made in error then appeal through the support link I gave you. They will be able to give you more context on the punishment, and if it was falsely applied, remove it.

I sent a support ticket as soon as I got the ban. I think I didn't structure it well enough after reading your comments.

Hopefully they can see that it was in error

Thanks for your prompt replies.
There should be. You'd be banned for life. {{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
Porky pies? There's no way you'd get any punishment for performing poorly alone - regardless of how many reports you received.

not entirely sure what you are trying to say?

when I logged in, it said I got reported for 1 game only.

and I clicked "Game 1" and it took me to the above game history

Wait. I'm confused.

The client linked you to that specific match history, and said you've been banned because you played like shit?

Yeah, said I was reported over 1 game, and linked to this match history.

I had a few off games before that, but my whole team lost and no one was too angry at each other.

Sounds like you've been shafted.

I thought you couldn't get banned for performing poorly. That'd just be stupid.

By this logic, there should be a "Poor performance" report criteria, but there's nothing of the sort.
